title: Armchair, "Peacock", Designed, 1947; produced  1950s
medium: Solid ash, rope cord, and teak
markings: Stamped on underside of seat: JOHANNES HANSEN COPENHAGEN DENMARK
provenance: 2011 from Paul Herring in memory of Jon N. Streep ; 1971 from the Estate of Jon N. Streep given to Paul and John Herring, The Collection of Jon N. Streep since he purchased it in the 1950's
creditline: From the collection of Jon N. Streep, given in his memory
description: Formed as a slatted back rest fanning out with spindles that resemble peacock feathers framed by a rounded crest rail ending in a rope cord seat.  The legs of the chair tilt out slightly and are connected by a stretcher.  Below the seat, two sticks rise up and are continued above by the arm support, where these two elements meet at an acute angle through the arm rests

tombstone.epitaph:
Armchair, "Peacock", Designed, 1947; produced  1950s.
Designed, 1947; produced  1950s. Solid ash, rope cord, and teak. From the collection of Jon N. Streep, given in his memory. 2011-35-1.
